short_description: Linear Regression is one of the fundamental types of predictive modeling algorithms. In linear regression, a dependent numeric variable is expressed in terms of the sum of one or more independent numeric variables, which are each multiplied by a numeric coefficient, usually with a constant term added to the sum of independent variables.
long_description: Linear Regression is one of the fundamental types of predictive modeling algorithms. In linear regression, a dependent numeric variable is expressed in terms of the sum of one or more independent numeric variables, which are each multiplied by a numeric coefficient, usually with a constant term added to the sum of independent variables.

argument_clauses.name: Inputcolumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name(s) of the column(s) representing the independent variables used in building a linear regression model.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name(s) of the column(s) representing the independent variables used in building a linear regression model.

argument_clauses.name: ResponseColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the column that represents the dependent variable.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the column that represents the dependent variable.

argument_clauses.name: GroupBycolumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name(s) of the column(s) dividing the input into partitions, one for each combination of values in the group by columns.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name(s) of the column(s) dividing the input into partitions, one for each combination of values in the group by columns.

argument_clauses.name: Stepwise
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to perform a stepwise procedure or not.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to perform a stepwise procedure or not.

argument_clauses.name: Backward
argument_clauses.rDescription: A backward step consists of computing the Partial F-Statistic for each variable and removing that with the smallest value if it is less than the criterion to remove.
argument_clauses.description: A backward step consists of computing the Partial F-Statistic for each variable and removing that with the smallest value if it is less than the criterion to remove.

argument_clauses.name: BackwardOnly
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to use only backward technique or not, i.e. a forward step is not performed.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to use only backward technique or not, i.e. a forward step is not performed.

argument_clauses.name: Forward
argument_clauses.rDescription: A forward step is made by determining the largest partial F-Statistic and adding the corresponding variable to the model.
argument_clauses.description: A forward step is made by determining the largest partial F-Statistic and adding the corresponding variable to the model.

argument_clauses.name: ForwardOnly
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to use only forward technique or not, i.e. a backward step is not performed.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to use only forward technique or not, i.e. a backward step is not performed.

argument_clauses.name: F-Statistic
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to use the partial F-Statistic in assessing whether a variable should be added or removed.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to use the partial F-Statistic in assessing whether a variable should be added or removed.

argument_clauses.name: T-StatisticP-value
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to use the T-Statistic P-value in assessing whether a variable should be added or removed.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to use the T-Statistic P-value in assessing whether a variable should be added or removed.

argument_clauses.name: Constant
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the linear model includes a constant term or not.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the linear model includes a constant term or not.

argument_clauses.name: MatrixInput
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the input teradataml DataFrame passed to argument 'data' represents an ESSCP matrix build by Matrix Building function or not.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the input teradataml DataFrame passed to argument 'data' represents an ESSCP matrix build by Matrix Building function or not.

argument_clauses.name: XMLReport
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to produce an XML report showing columns that may be collinear as part of the output or not.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to produce an XML report showing columns that may be collinear as part of the output or not.

argument_clauses.name: StatsReport
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to produce an additional data quality report which includes the mean and standard deviation of each model variable, derived from an ESSCP matrix.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to produce an additional data quality report which includes the mean and standard deviation of each model variable, derived from an ESSCP matrix.

argument_clauses.name: ConditionIndexThreshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the condition index threshold value to use while generating near dependency report.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the condition index threshold value to use while generating near dependency report.

argument_clauses.name: EntranceCriterion
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the criterion to enter a variable into the model. The Partial F-Statistic must be greater than this value, or the T-Statistic P-value must be less than this value.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the criterion to enter a variable into the model. The Partial F-Statistic must be greater than this value, or the T-Statistic P-value must be less than this value.

argument_clauses.name: RemoveCriterion
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the criterion to remove a variable from the model. The Partial F-Statistic must be less than this value, or the T-Statistic P-value must be greater than this value.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the criterion to remove a variable from the model. The Partial F-Statistic must be less than this value, or the T-Statistic P-value must be greater than this value.

argument_clauses.name: VarianceProportionThreshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the variance proportion threshold value to use while generating near dependency report.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the variance proportion threshold value to use while generating near dependency report.
